title: Drawing
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite
markings: Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Vertical rectangle. Subdivided into a panel below, decorated with a trophy or arms; surrounded by a wreath standing upon it, and the remaining part of the outer frame. Panel for the inscription. On top of the frame of the inscription is a prelate's escutcheon between two acroteria. A festoon  hangs in the panel of the outer frame. Laterally, two candelabra crowned with flames. The dimensions are written inside or beside. Dark background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing.
Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-1910.
